Job Description:
About Phil

US healthcare costs continue to escalate while patient outcomes continue to plummet. By pioneering a software platform that connects patients, pharmacies, doctors, insurers, and manufacturers, Phil (www.phil.us) is building a systemic solution for a systemic problem. Our software brings together the key stakeholders within the specialty pharmacy ecosystem to provide patients with reliable access to medications at the lowest price possible. Our mission: better outcomes for everyone at lower costs.

Founded in 2015, Phil works with over 36,000 doctors nationwide, serving their patients in all 50 states. We are a Series B health-tech startup ($35M in raised capital) in hyper-growth mode: last year we increased our revenue 15x and tripled the size of our team. Ready to join our team of mission-driven, analytical, and passionate people?

The Role

We are looking for our first analytics hire - an Analytics Lead to build our capabilities. We strive to be data-driven in all our decisions, which means we need visibility into the key drivers of our business across Sales, Product, Operations (Supply and Demand), and more. We use metrics to ensure an uninterrupted supply of medications for our patients, operational efficiency for our partner pharmacies, and an exceptional prescribing experience to our partner doctors. From day one, you will get to solve interesting problems and build for scale. If you are passionate about leading teams, making data-driven decisions, and tracking progress we want to hear from you!

You Will

Work with business stakeholders to improve our self-serve data model
Manage and own our data platform (Looker and Mode)
Start as an individual contributor, but quickly assess the situation and recommend new hires for the Analytics Team you will lead
Build automated dashboards and reports to drive awareness and understanding of key metrics and processes
Work closely with the Engineering team to ensure we capture all the necessary data in the proper format

About You

Experience with business intelligence technologies and strong understanding of database architecture
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Fluency in SQL and other programming languages. Some development experience in at least one scripting language (PHP, Python, Perl, R, etc.)
Strong background in statistics with the ability to explain analytical methodologies simply and thoroughly
A sense of ownership: you would develop, manage, and evolve the core logic of a mission-critical and consequential consumer experience


Preferred Qualifications

A technical or engineering background (e.g. BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Stats, or related technical field)
5+ years of work experience in an Analytics or Technical role
Previous managerial experience
Experience working with Looker is a plus
Startup mindset and the ability to operate within a fast-paced work environment


Why Phil

Ground floor opportunity with one of the fastest-growing startups in health-tech
Solve a problem that matters: be part of a company that uniquely leverages technology to bring wellness to all of its stakeholders
Work in a highly collaborative environment with other creative, mission-driven folks!
Competitive compensation (commensurate with experience)
Full benefits (medical, dental, vision)
401(k) contribution opportunity

Requirements:
· Possess a B.S. In Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering or related field preferred or equivalent combination of education and work experience.

· Strong understanding of how business requirements are gathered, analyzed and documented.

· Hands-on experience with relational databases and SQL and the ability to learn and understand complex systems.

· Excellent technical writing skills and ability to document software requirements in a crisp way.

· Outstanding presentation and interpersonal skills with the ability to negotiate business/technical requirements and project schedules with a customer.

· Exceptional analytical skills with the ability to learn from customers, analyze past projects and advise top management on how the sales strategy can be improved and how reusable technical solutions can be developed.

· Ability to prioritize effectively and handle shifting priorities smoothly and professionally.

· Detail-oriented with exceptional time management and organizational skills.

· Superb interpersonal and communication skills, discretion, and excellent judgment.

· Experience with customer support.

About Us
We're ClickTime. We help businesses become more productive every day. Our time and expense tracking tools are used by thousands of companies worldwide. ClickTime HQ is located in San Francisco, with additional offices in Denver and Austin.

Our office is in the heart of downtown San Francisco with great food and coffee just steps away. We provide big company benefits (competitive salary, medical/dental/vision, subsidized transit, 401(k) with matching, very good coffee, chocolate) while maintaining the size and energy of a startup. Working with us means you’ll be challenged, surrounded by high quality teammates, and learn something new every day.

At a Glance
ClickTime’s mission is to help drive performance for companies worldwide - and as an Associate Business Analyst at ClickTime, you’ll be the standard bearer of that mission. Working with every team at the company, you’ll ask and answer broad questions about company performance that will not only illuminate how we are doing, but where we need to go. If you’re curious, analytical, and love working in collaborative, multidisciplinary environments, we want to talk to you!
Responsibilities
Build strong relationships with business stakeholders to understand their business objectives and the data they need to inform decisions
Break down business questions into logical components, transforming those components into data solutions and reports
Ensure that data delivered to internal customers is accurate, reliable, and meets their needs
Prioritize requirements to maximize business value for ClickTime
Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree
2+ years professional experience. We will consider recent graduates with relevant academic and/or internship experience as well
Ability to put themselves in the (internal) customer's shoes and understand their needs and challenges
Excellent communication skills, problem solving skills, and analytical skills
Experience in data analysis and reporting
Affinity for technology. High proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets; comfortable with computer operating systems and concepts
ClickTime provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

KQED is seeking a quantitative, driven, process/detail-oriented and creative business analyst, who will serve as a member of KQED's Business Planning & Operations team. This position will have a day-to-day focus on providing analytical, strategic, and operational support for KQED organization.

Responsibilities:

The Analyst will work cross-functionally with several teams at KQED, with the objective of driving insights and supporting the data needs of them. A successful candidate will have exceptional analytical skills, thorough understanding of databases and data visualization, ability to synthesize and make recommendations based on data from multiple sources (internal and external), strong partner and communication skills, and a background in data-driven decision-making. The candidate must be intellectually curious, learn quickly, and be able to move fast while maintaining focus on high-impact projects. The candidate is capable of identifying and understanding relationships among business, mission and technology needs, issues and data. The candidate is responsible for business needs gathering and prioritization, process development and improvement in all business units.
Work with business leads, business stakeholders, subject matter experts, and technical staff to gather, develop and prioritize business needs in the form of documented needs, use cases and user stories
Identifying and refining current and futureâstate business processes by performing deep dive analysis of current state and propose future state solutions effectively using clear and precise documentation
Own functional tasks and deliverables, including: process definition, requirement gathering, fit/gap analysis, functional design/specifications, system design, testing, training, reporting, support and continuous improvement of business applications
Analyze and build out our business, financial and operations requirements and system goals, identify gaps, evaluate options, design and deliver quality solutions
Understands and evaluate business unit workflows and applies technology solutions in support of the workflows
Provides support for application enhancements, application integrations, quality assurance and change control processes
Understand and balance the needs of multiple stakeholders, identify appropriate compromises and recognize tradeoffs necessary to achieve maximum alignment with desired mission outcomes
Design and implement analytical reports to be used for decision making by stakeholders and management effectively summarize and present findings, including recommendations
Facilitating the business stakeholder's efforts to envision the future, providing objective technical expertise in informing possibilities, and identifying changes needed to support the future objectives and outcomes
Ensure the consistency and quality of data across the company
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data visualization and data-mining to tell the story behind numbers and derive actionable insight for stakeholders and leadership
Develop new and iterate on existing dashboards and reporting tools to automate reporting
Drive continuous improvement of reporting/analytics through process or tolling enhancements and/or automation
Qualification:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or related field and 8 years of Business Analysis experience
Familiarity with data mining and statistical analysis
Project management skills
Demonstrated problem solving experience with experience providing business insights and recommendations from data sets
Demonstrated experience presenting technical content to non-technical audiences
Communicate complex analysis and insights to senior leaders, both verbally and in writing
Perform and assist others in performing in-depth analysis and identification of the root cause of the key issues
Detail-oriented, organized, self-motivated, and a great team player
Ability to work independently or in a team environment
Ability to meet deadlines and deliver projects on time and on budget
Understand data flow, relationships, integrations and downstream impact
Excellent listening and interpersonal skills
Ability to translate analysis results into business recommendations
Proficiency in writing SQL queries, and knowledge of Data Warehouses
Experience in developing reports and dashboards
Ability to design and document complex business systems
Experience identifying opportunities for business improvement and defining/measuring the success to those initiatives
Provide data insights, determine what is important, clarify next steps and delegate to meet expectations
Experience or familiarity with CRM platforms
Familiarity with nonprofit organizations (preferred but not required)
Let us tell you more about our benefits:

Whether you're single, married, have children, are in a domestic partnership or anything in between, we have you covered. Employees at KQED enjoy a family-friendly workplace offering 20 days of paid time off, 11 paid holidays, paid parental leave, family medical leave benefits, comprehensive health/vision/dental and commuter benefits as well as a 403(b) with employer match. KQED encourages diversity, openness and offers training to support personal and professional development. In addition, we are proud to offer Employee Resource Groups, wellness programs as well as free KQED membership.

The mission that drives us:

KQED is for everyone who wants to be more.
Our television, radio, digital media, and educational services change lives for the better and help individuals and communities achieve their full potential.

KQED serves the people of Northern California with a community-supported alternative to commercial media.
We provide citizens with the knowledge they need to make informed decisions; convene community dialogue; bring the arts to everyone and engage audiences to share their stories. We help students and teachers thrive in 21st-century classrooms, and take people of all ages on journeys of exploration- exposing them to new people, places and ideas.

We celebrate diversity, embrace innovation, value lifelong learning and partner with those who share our passion for public services.

relationships between multiple business partners to drive engagement in ADAPT

in conducting interviews and facilitating group meetings.

in developing and conducting training programs.

communication skills, both written and verbal, including the ability to

problem solving and analytical thinking and ability to approach problems

Our client is a fast-growth software vendor that offers award winning software through a cloud model. The company is in high growth mode and offers a competitive compensation and equity. We are currently seeking a talented Business Analyst candidate with CRM/ configure-price-quote for this exciting opportunity:

Position title: Business Analyst

Location: San Jose, California

Position description:

We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst to join our clients business systems team and assist in their ongoing project roadmap, development, and support of their quote-to-cash process. The Business Analyst will be responsible for functional and technical system design, documentation, optimization, administration and customization. The Business Analyst is also responsible for responding to day to day change requests in support of business operations. The ideal candidate is passionate about improving the end user experience, enjoys working with business stakeholders, and thrives on the challenge of solving complex business problems in a fast paced, rapidly growing organization.

Position responsibilities:
Work with sales and order operations, legal and revenue teams to understand the sales lifecycle and deal governance, and establish a framework for managing through the system
Manage day-to-day needs, update user permissions, troubleshoot errors, configure product and pricing rules, advanced approvals, quoting templates, digital signatures, workflow routing, validation rules and triggers, improvements to user interface
Maintain holistic view of all business processes and users in the system to understand cross-functional impacts with regards to configuration, process, workflow, and reporting
Work with teams on optimizing upstream and downstream integration points such as lead life cycle, new business, add-ons, renewals, digital signatures, order processing, and provisioning
Proactively manage regular system maintenance, identify and resolve system issues, and drive improvements and data governance strategies
Coordinate testing, upgrades, and configuration of system files and services
Participate in ongoing CRM enhancement projects and assist in technical rollout
Create and maintain detailed set of instructions, system configuration, flowcharts, reports, dashboards and other documentation as needed
Required skills:
3+ years of experience working with services or sales teams implementing CRM/ Configure, price, quote projects
CRM and quote to cash certifications, and configuration experience preferred
Ability to view situations with both a business and technical lens
Fundamental understanding of subscription-based businesses
Excellent leadership, communication, and organizational skills
Ability to prioritize deliverables and adjust to changing demands in a fast-paced environment
Creative problem solver with a proactive approach
Advanced Salesforce administration is required
Experience with Salesforce development (APEX, VisualForce, Lightning) and familiarity with enterprise development lifecycle concepts is preferred
Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Finance, Information Technology or related field
Competitors: Career Brokers, Job Juncture, Apple & Associates

Job Description:
Job Description
Job Description

Coordinate and facilitate work across cross-functional teams for the purpose of eliciting detailed business requirements. Document requirements using standardized templates including business rules, business process flows, use cases and test cases. Conduct walkthroughs and reviews of deliverables and facilitate approvals according to PMO governance. Partner with technology teams through requirements gathering, design, and with testing teams through QA and UAT to ensure end product meets requirements. Coordinate and facilitate work across cross-functional teams (Product, Technology, Operations, compliance, financial crime, analysis and other key business partners), for the purpose of eliciting detailed business requirements.

Requirements
Applied experience and knowledge of: Deposit treasury management products within financial services industry. Documenting Customer Information Reporting requirements. Legal, compliance and regulatory driven requirements – e.g., Know-your-customer (KYC), Anti-Money Laundering (AML), FDIC, FATCA
Applied experience in Business Requirements Gathering
Experience in writing BRDs
Use case development
Preferred Skills
Minimum 5 years business analysis experience specifically in the field of business requirements development for treasury management products and services – in particular, US and/or international Deposit products
Knowledge of full SDLC. Exposure to Agile methodology is a plus.
Proficiency with MS Office software products including MS Project, Power Point, Word, Excel, Visio, SharePoint.
Business Process Analysis and Modeling
Flow charting experience – Visio is must.
Process oriented thinking and approach is important - ability to break down into step-by-step flow.
Excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to clearly communicate ideas to diverse business and technical audiences

Company Description
ATR is a trusted career partner for tech pros and other professionals, boasting a 30-year track record of connecting talent to some of the most exciting opportunities available today. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, ATR maintains relationships with innovative companies requiring both temporary and direct-placement individuals. We’ve created an inclusive culture where diversity is celebrated and your professional goals are the priority. That ensures you’re always in a comfortable environment that moves your career forward.

Scribd
/skribbed/ (n).
1. a tech company changing the way the world reads
2. a membership that gives users access to the world’s largest online library of books, audiobooks, sheet music, news, and magazines

We value trying new things, craftsmanship, being an open book, and the people that make our team great.
Join us and build something meaningful.

The mission of the business analytics team is to ensure the entire company understands business performance and trends, and to empower all business teams to make good decisions with data. This is a new team that will bridge the gap between data science and business teams and play a critical role in driving Scribd's next stage of growth.
About You:You are a business analytics leader who is excited to be a founding member of this newly formed team. You are highly analytical, love solving ambiguous business problems through numbers and equations. You have great business intuition that helps you create actionable insights from data, and you know how to distribute the data in a digestible, information-rich way.
You Will
Work hands-on in the data, using SQL, Tableau and other tools to extract, analyze, and visualize data.
Keep the company up to date on overall business performance through dashboards and regular company updates.
Partner closely with product, growth, content, marketing, finance, and other business teams to arm them with the data and deep insights they need to make great decisions.
Collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to determine the highest business priorities and opportunities.
Define and maintain common metric definitions across the business.
You Have
3+ years experience with quantitative data analysis.
Strong SQL experience, familiarity with Excel and BI tools.
Plus if you have experience with Tableau.
BA/BS degree in math, stats, CS, physics or equivalent experience.
Highly analytical mindset with demonstrated ability to work through complex, ambiguous problems using data.
Experience working at a fast growing tech company.
Why we work here
• We are located in downtown San Francisco, within walking distance of Caltrain and BART
• Health benefits: 100% employer covered Medical/Dental/Vision for regular, full-time employees
• Generous PTO policy plus we close for the last week in December
• 401k matching
• Paid Parental leave
• Monthly wellness budget and fully paid membership to our onsite fitness facility
• Professional development: generous annual budget for our employees to attend conferences, classes, and other events
• Three meals a day, catered from local restaurants
• Apple laptops and any equipment you want to customize your work station
• Free Scribd membership and a yearly reading stipend!
• Company events that include monthly happy hours and offsites (past events include Santa Cruz, bowling, arcades, geocaching, ropes courses, etc.)

In the meantime, check out our office and meet some of the team at https://www.scribd.com/about

Scribd values diversity, and we make all hiring and employment decisions based on merit, qualifications, competence, talent, and contribution, not who you are by choice or circumstance. We value the people who make Scribd a great place to work and strive to create an environment where your work is supported and personhood respected.

Founded in 2013, Thistle is an early stage food-tech startup empowering our customers to get and stay healthy. We deliver delicious, organic, healthy, plant-forward meals, cold-pressed juices and snacks to customers in California who want to put their nutrition on auto-pilot.

We don’t want to be just another food delivery startup. Our focus is on the health and happiness of our customers, and we are revolutionizing how fresh, nutritious, high-quality food is purchased, manufactured, and delivered at scale. Thistle is headquartered in San Francisco and we are backed by some amazing investors in the Bay Area and beyond.

We’re looking for a skilled Business Analyst to join our fast-paced work environment. As a key member of our Growth team, you’ll contribute directly to overall strategy, working to provide valuable, data-driven insights to a cross-functional team. You will gain exposure to multiple functions, work closely with Thistle’s leadership team, and have the opportunity to have a huge impact at an exciting time for our business. This role reports directly to the SVP of Growth & Strategy and is based in our sunny SF office.
What You'll Do
Perform financial forecasting, analysis, reporting, and operational metrics tracking
Serve as a business partner to Product, Operations, and Finance to manage departmental budgets, and develop meaningful KPIs to measure efficacy of organizations and their spend
Perform variance analysis, identify trends, and make recommendations for improvements
Identify and drive process improvements, including the creation of standard and ad-hoc reports, tools, and dashboards
Leverage insightful, zero-defect analysis to identify opportunities for and then implement operational improvements
Who You Are
You are data-driven, able to analyze data with strong attention to detail and accuracy, and passionate about telling the story behind the numbers
Have excellent verbal and written communication skills - you’ll need to collaborate with internal team members and external business partners
You are a strong business thinker, able to use ‘first principles’ to understand and solve challenging business problems at their root level
You are a self-motivated, fast learner, excited about developing your analytical and problem-solving skills in a mission driven business
You are comfortable in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment and able to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously
What You'll Bring
1-2 years of experience in investment banking, accounting, or finance-related role at a startup
BA/BS degree in related field
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Amazing modeling, reporting, and presentation skills (Excel, Powerpoint)
Proven proficiency with SQL and data visualization a plus
Life At Thistle
Join a diverse, passionate & driven team of all backgrounds
Delicious & nutritious meals, snacks & juice to help keep you feeling healthy and energized
Casual work environmentFun team outings (BBQs, happy hours, etc.)
Comprehensive health benefits (medical, dental, vision) to fit your needs

Lambda School is a combination of a school and an investment fund. Lambda School's mission is to find untapped or underutilized talent, and to train that talent for the most in-demand jobs in the world. Lambda School is pioneering a new model of higher education in which the school invests in the students, instead of the other way around.

Lambda has just successfully completed its Series B fund raising round with premier tier venture investors. We are operating in 40+ states across the US today and eyeing international expansion opportunities.

We’re looking for a data-driven and well-rounded Business Associate to join our Data & Analytics team at Lambda School to help us build a best in class understanding of our business. Your role will deepen our understanding of the journey our students take from applying all the way to placement in jobs. Because we are student focused, our goal is to understand what makes their experience as productive as possible. We are turning the traditional education business model on its head with where we invest in students who only pay when they get a new job using the skills they learned with us. With the Income Sharing Agreement (ISA) financing model, we have unlocked the potential for people to seek a better life without the worry of student debt. We invest in our students to create a truly aligned education model where our student’s success is directly tied to our company’s success. This role will undoubtedly help to shape the thinking of a new industry, and we are looking for the right candidate ready to make an impact.
Duties & Responsibilities
Develop a deep understanding of how we find, train, and help place students using the data to describe their journey
Plan, build, and enhance the way we share how the company is performing with the internal business owners
Own key performance indicators of the line of business you’re responsible for
Drive optimization in key business processes by surfacing and framing key data
Ensure data quality by understanding sources and communicating known issues
Ability to translate analysis results into business recommendations
Use your proficiency in wrangling and transforming data to clearly illustrate the operations of the business
A successful candidate will...
Bring energy, inquisitiveness, creativity, kindness, analytical thinking, problem solving, and a relentlessness to their work
Prioritize many ongoing projects, stay organized, and communicate well with team members
Have a strong willingness to dive deep into the processes of the company, identify areas of improvement, implement efficiencies/automate manual efforts
Thrive in fast-paced environments and be unafraid to take on challenges
Be student obsessed and always a student
What You'll Need
2+ years of experience in an internal customer facing data oriented role, analytics, data science, or similar field
Sound understanding of the fundamentals of what makes a business work, ability to hypothesize the impact of changes, and how to find data to confirm or disprove the hypothesis
Experience with databases and SQL
Experience sharing data with web based BI tools like Looker
Proficiency in with Python or R, with or without Jupyter notebooks is a plus

At Delta Dental, our strategy is only as strong as the people who execute it! We are hiring individuals that are not just right for today but also for our future. The Business Analyst position is within the Risk, Ethics and Compliance department and is critical in establishing and monitoring risk registers & indicators, implementing corrective action plans, conducting risk assessments and evaluating the effectiveness of the company's control framework. This position includes supporting the development and implementation of control procedures and monitoring activities that support the enterprise-wide risk management activities. The Business Analyst will operate cross functionally and in areas with significant ambiguity and complexity from both a legal and operational frame of reference. This position offers great competency learning and personal growth opportunities.
How you will make an impact:
Creates and maintains risk register items in Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) system platform.
Completes risk scoring and analysis and does research for risk assessments and trend documentation.
Analyzes transactions, internal reports and financial information for risk assessments.
Develops relationships and partnerships with the business units for risk reporting and periodic risk attestations.
Assists in the valuation of the effectiveness of the company's internal control framework in addressing risks and accomplishing the company’s goals and objectives.
Assists in providing training and technical support to management and employees regarding risk management strategies and programs.
Develops in depth working knowledge of the GRC functional processes and Technology applications that support the risk management process.
Researches risk implications, drafts risk assessments and performs analyses to frame risk discussions with business unit partners.
Assists in creating risk training and providing GRC risk program technical support to management and employees.
Researches and drafts documents to present legal and business options to facilitate discussion of compliance requirements.
Assists in drafting risk project plans, coordinates project meetings and documentation, monitors and reports on progress.
Performs miscellaneous duties as assigned.
What we look for:
Bachelor’s degree in business management, finance, economics, statistics, computer science and/or other related fields.
2 years experience in business management, risk, legal, healthcare regulatory analysis or compliance experience, business operations, or project management desired.
Comparable education or experience may be considered.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environment to drive project initiatives and work with other analysts on the team.
Preferred knowledge of technical analytical tools e.g. Tableau, Collibra, RSA Archer GRC.
Drives to meet priorities in a methodical, organized way; proactively manages workload to anticipate and resolve conflicting deadlines.
Detail-oriented; flexible and creative.
Demonstrates personal integrity; acts ethically in all business interactions, internally and externally; consistently strives to do the right thing; follows through on commitments.
Strong analytical, problem solving and negotiation skills.
Critical thinking skills with a bias toward action and a "get things done" attitude.
Open to change, ambiguity, and new ideas; can decide and act under guidance without having the total picture.
Knowledge of project development life cycle a plus.
Knowledge of risk management and healthcare regulatory processes a plus.
Knowledge of risk standards like ISO, COSO, FAIR a plus.
Knowledge of Delta Dental products, policies, claims, eligibility and underwriting procedures and guidelines, optional.
Knowledge of health care- medical, vision and dental- and insurance industry issues is a plus.
Ability to maintain confidentiality.
Ability to travel as needed- minimal travel <5>
Benefits and perks:
12 days starting vacation plus 11 holidays and your birthday off!
Multiple medical insurance options: 100% paid or low cost premiums
100% paid dental insurance
100% paid vision insurance
Onsite gym and/or gym discount and fitness incentive
Culture of learning: substantial tuition reimbursement to improve your skills

About Scoop

Scoop brings co-workers and neighbors together to enjoy a smooth carpooling experience—unlocking new opportunities to create friendships, improve their well-being, and make the most of their valuable time.

Learn more in Crunchbase: https://news.crunchbase.com/news/scoop-raises-60m-for-corporate-carpooling-as-gridlock-ruins-america/

About the Senior Business Analyst Role

Carpooling has been around for decades, but its impact has been difficult to measure and understand. At Scoop, we have a unique opportunity to use analytics to understand and showcase the impact of our carpooling community. As a Senior Business Analyst at Scoop, you will be responsible for helping answer fundamental strategic questions that influence how we sell, market, and expand. You will partner cross-functionally with our Product, Sales, Customer Success, Operations and Finance teams to provide visibility into our data, make strategic recommendations and drive the successful growth of Scoop. Every piece of data at Scoop is tied to real human connection that happens between commuters nationwide, and every insight you discover helps us connect more and more people together.
In this role, you will:
Actively generate insights and recommendations that influence business strategy at all stages: Sales, Launch, and Growth
Partner with business function leads in building market health and customer management dashboards and reports that drive and expedite data-backed decisions
Deep dive into customer performance to identify opportunities to grow the Scoop program
Partner with Data Engineering to create scalable data processes and help evolve our internal analytics products
Act like an owner - constantly strive to develop domain expertise and share it with others.
You should have:
An undergraduate degree in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or a similar quantitative field (or have equivalent additional work experience)
5+ years of work experience analyzing quantitative data
SQL expertise and comfort querying large datasets
Experience with at least one scripting language used for data analysis (e.g., R, Python). Intellectual curiosity and aptitude to pick up new technical skills
The ability to clearly explain complicated analyses to non-technical audiences and tell compelling, concise stories with data
Experience managing objectives and expectations with multiple stakeholders
Expert ability to balance pressure for statistical rigor with timely business decision-making
You might also have:
Experience working closely with Sales, Customer Success, Operations and/or Finance teams
Familiarity with using data visualization tools like Periscope or Tableau to display business trends and performance
Predictive modeling experience using R or Python


Life @ Scoop

Founded in 2015 and based in downtown SF, our team mixes technology and elbow grease every day, with one statistic in our crosshairs: 80% of Americans drive alone to work. At Scoop, we envision a world where commuters feel empowered — starting with a choice to make their commute a meaningful part of their day. We embody that same spirit within our own culture, empowering every team member to make this the most meaningful experience of their career.

Walk into Scoop and you’ll find a furry, tail-wagging welcoming committee. In many ways these fluffy faces exemplify the energy that flows through our office. They are a reminder that while we’re focused and driven, we shouldn’t take ourselves too seriously. They also help bridge the gap between our homes and our workplace, just like a Scoop carpool.

The atmosphere overall is dynamic and unique. It’s influenced by our backgrounds at successful startups, big tech companies, and premier consulting firms — blended and crafted into what feels natural and right for this company. It plays out in our balance of scrappy and strategic, frameworks and fast thinking.

At Scoop, we’re all united by our desire to change the way people get to work — and committed to enjoying the journey together along the way.

Job Summary

Crowe is expanding and is hiring in the Sacramento area. We are seeking a senior government consultant with three to five years of management consulting experience. The candidate will help clients solve business issues that help improve business processes, maximize technology investments, and mitigate risks.
Define solutions to meet client needs and address critical issues and business challenges;
Assist in business development activities and written proposals;
Analyze business processes and programs and define recommendations;
Develop and maintain relationships with clients;
Research and analyze background documents, program issues, and best practices;
Interview and facilitate meetings with client staff and stakeholders;
Document workload, staffing, technology systems, and costs;
Prepare written documents and presentations;
Present to clients findings and recommendations.
Company Overview

Your Journey at Crowe Starts Here:

At Crowe, you have the opportunity to deliver innovative solutions to today’s complex business issues. Crowe’s accounting, consulting, and technology personnel are widely recognized for their in-depth expertise and understanding of sophisticated process frameworks and enabling technologies, along with their commitment to delivering measurable results that help clients build business value. Our focus on emerging technology solutions along with our commitment to internal career growth and exceptional client value has resulted in a firm that is routinely recognized as a “Best Place to Work.” We are 75 years strong and still growing. Come grow with us!

Qualifications
Undergraduate degree with 5 to 8 years of experience; or, graduate degree with 3 to 5 years of experience
Consulting experience specifically with public sector clients in California
Business process analysis experience
PAL (Project Approval Lifecycle) experience
Excellent analytical and quantitative skills
Strong communication, writing, and organizational skills
A track record of producing high-quality work products on-time and within budget
Ability to be flexible and to learn quickly about different client programs
Ability to work independently and contribute as a member of the project team

Ability to work closely with project manager and other team members to drive project results
Solid project planning and management skills
Understands business process concepts and principles.

Master’s degree (preferably in Business, Economics, Information Technology, or Public Administration)
Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) Certification
Business Process Certification
Build a Successful Future in Consulting

At Crowe, Consulting professionals provide thought leadership, process expertise, technology insight and help clients identify, assess, evaluate, and reduce risks. Our Consulting professionals serve large organizations across many industries in an environment where innovation and new ideas are highly encouraged. Through various programs, we provide you with learning and reinvention through high-impact formal and systemic training, including industry, solution, technology, and consulting training, as well as certification. You will be part of a strong global team environment with a fast-paced, challenging, and collaborative setting.

At Crowe, we strongly endorse an open door policy. Our partners are approachable and accessible across the entire organization. Our team-based culture encourages partners to be in touch with our professionals and active on client projects. The partners of our company lead by example and maintain a strong two-way channel of communication with their teams. We strive to create an environment that is relaxed, fun, dynamic and fulfilling. Our team-based culture has not only resulted in successful projects, but in long lasting friendships as well. Overall, our people find their career choices to be highly rewarding and fulfilling.

HOW YOU CAN GROW:

We will nurture your talent in an inclusive culture that values diversity. You will have the chance to meet on a consistent basis with your Career Coach that will guide you in your career goals and dreams.

Crowe (www.crowe.com) is one of the largest public accounting, consulting and technology firms in the United States. Crowe uses its deep industry expertise to provide audit services to public and private entities while also helping clients reach their goals with tax, advisory, risk and performance services. Crowe is recognized by many organizations as one of the country's best places to work. Crowe serves clients worldwide as an independent member of Crowe Global, one of the largest global accounting networks in the world. The network consists of more than 200 independent accounting and advisory services firms in more than 130 countries around the world.

Visit Crowe.com and find out what it's like to work at one of the “50 Best Workplaces for New College Graduates.” Crowe ranked seventh on this Fortune list, in addition to being named one of Fortune’s “Top 100 Best Companies to Work For” and among Fortune’s “20 Best Workplaces in Consulting & Professional Services”. In these surveys, Crowe personnel attribute the following policies to making Crowe a great place to work:

Innovation: Each year, Crowe invests about two percent of firm revenue in new product development funding to develop ideas brought forward by its people. Building upon a foundation of deep industry specialization, Crowe professionals follow a detailed innovation road map to create original, practical solutions that help address their clients’ biggest challenges. This process allows them to see their ideas through from start to finish.

Mobility strategy: Rolled out more than two years ago, this strategy defied the norm of the professional services industry. It allows Crowe personnel to work where they’re most productive – whether that be the office, their home or elsewhere – and wear jeans while they’re in the office. This policy continues to receive great reviews on annual internal employee engagement surveys.

Benefits: The firm promotes healthy living through its internal well-being portal, which allows Crowe individuals to complete wellness activities – such as exercise challenges, healthy eating, doctor visits and mindful lifestyle changes – for gift cards and health insurance premium reductions. Additionally, on top of its healthcare and retirement programs, Crowe recently expanded its paid time off policies for military leave and all new parents.

Community service: Recently acknowledged in the Fortune Best Workplaces for Giving Back list, the firm places a high priority on community service. In honor of the firm’s 75th year, Crowe personnel not only achieved, but surpassed their goal of 75,000 hours of volunteering. We're proud to announce that we volunteered 82,000 hours – giving back to the communities where we live and work. That’s the equivalent of 39 full-time employees at the nonprofits we served! In addition, Crowe has policies in place to align its charitable contributions with the volunteer efforts of its people.

What if the company you worked for gave time back to millions of people? At Veem that's just what we do. The old way of paying a business, with technology built in the '70s, takes hours out of business owners lives every week. Hours they can give back to their employees, their family, their passion. Hours to do what they got into business to do, be it making cupcakes, creating educational toys, or being professional gamers – all examples from our customers. At Veem we are disrupting that '70s tech with the most advanced business payments network on the planet. We should know, we built it. Join Veem and let's give business owners the payment system they deserve.

As an Analyst of Business Analytics, you will work all across the organization to help shape our business and pricing strategies by processing, analyzing and interpreting huge data sets. Using analytical precision and statistical methods, you will mine through data to identify opportunities to better optimize our service for customers through pricing analytics, cost optimization, market analytics - forecasting, segmentation, behavioral vs demographics.

Pricing is the most critical part of your job. With hundreds of corridors and tiers, you must bring the ability to demonstrate elasticity and CLV from pricing proposals based on your ability to interpret site and account information.

In the end, you do more than just crunch the numbers. You work with Sales, Marketing, and Product leadership to help drive insightful actions through your findings. Identifying the problem is only half the job; you also figure out the solution.

Responsibilities
Primarily supporting Sales and Marketing
Pricing analytics - Formulate, present and implement pricing proposals for numerous corridors and tiers keeping in consideration: volume and margin inter-dependencies, customer segmentation, foreign exchange costs, and CLV, among other considerations.
Work closely with Product to ensure precise and secure implementation of all required pricing actions. You should be able to navigate across datasets to bring elasticity and CLV results back.
Business analytics – perform, evaluate and interpret for executive leadership team, analysis on business metrics to include: CLV, retention, segmentation and tiering of customers, acquisition and churn trigger.
Acquisition modeling – join customer segmentation, sales cycles, and CLV analysis to help project future growth of our various channels. Provide insights through modelling on what is our most efficient approach for scaling.
Communicate business findings and strategic recommendations to senior management. Drive the implementation of Analytics Platforms that connect data systems and Business Intelligence systems.
Qualifications

Requirements:
Minimum of Bachelor's degree, MBA desirable
Minimum of 6 years of experience in business analytics
Experience with SQL. Experience in statistical modeling techniques.
Strength in matching customer behavior to revenue implications.
Experience and understanding in price elasticity.
Demonstrated ability to understand all parts of the business
Strong analytical ability and ability to assess cross functional processes
Exceptional system application skills, comfortable operating in multiple systems to extract and analyze data, including Sales Force, Looker, Snowflake. Expert level skill in MS Excel or other analytical tools.
Demonstrated track record of applying creative thinking and analysis to solve business needs in ambiguous environments. Must have experience implementing operational rigor and programs across organizations
Additional Qualifications
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively with people in diverse and different settings
Exceptional oral and written communication and presentation skills, with ability to summarize analytics and modeling challenges in a suitable format and content for easy consumption by the audience
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, environment where you must take on multiple responsibilities and do what it takes to get things done

Job Description:


The Business Analyst conducts customer, process, market, and resource analysis to develop plans, requirements, and solutions for internal and external customers. To achieve this goal, the Business Analyst will use traditional project management analytical frameworks combined with a deep understanding of the AssetMark business, cost structure, and customer needs to collaboratively develop solutions that are cost effective, efficient, and meet business needs.

Business Analysts participate in the full project lifecycle from conception through post-deployment. The Business Analyst will frequently have a lead role in compiling and presenting information regarding proposed solutions, high level and detailed business requirements, functional specifications, project progress, and post implementation effectiveness of deployed initiatives.

This position will primarily focus on current and future mergers and acquisitions from deal closing through integration planning and execution. Based on the acquisitions pipeline, this position will secondarily focus on strategic organizational initiatives, participating in IT teams to analyze, recommend, and implement business solutions. The Business Analyst will play a key role in all phases of these strategic business programs.

Responsibilities:
Serves as business liaison between business areas, senior leadership, and IT development and support for both internal and external customers
Elicits business requirements using appropriate tools and techniques including but not limited to interviews, document analysis, surveys, site visits, use cases, scenarios, business processes, task and workflow analysis
Analyzes and evaluates data gathered from multiple sources and distinguish user requests from underlying true business needs
Collaborates with business process owners to identify and maximize opportunities to use information and technology to improve product, service and business processes
Documents use cases, requirements and business rules, business model diagrams, and data requirements
Creates current and future state process and data models to help engage stakeholders and drive requirements gathering and gap analysis
Prioritizes and translates high-level and detailed business requirements into detailed functional specifications

Manages the change control, versioning, tracking, and traceability of all requirements and specifications documents throughout the project life cycle
Manages daily activities, working sessions, issue resolutions, and communications across project and support teams in order to deliver projects and enhancements on-time, on-budget, and within scope
Assists with the development of training materials and procedures including post production support documentation
Contributes to Project Management deliverables and metrics under the direction of the Project Manager
Aids in maintenance of project schedules and tracking of life cycle phases including timely project status reporting back to stakeholders and project team members
Engages with project stakeholders and motivates project team members toward common goals and objectives
Required Qualifications:
Minimum 3 years’ experience in asset management industry in the capacity of a business analyst, a business systems analyst, an operations analyst, or a customer relationship specialist working directly with customer or end users, gathering requirements and writing documentation
Minimum 3 years’ experience managing relationships with customers and business partners in a complex and fast-paced environment
Experience in asset management platforms and applications Experience working on complex, cross functional projects documenting client organization’s direction, structure, business processes, requirements, and functional specifications.

Overview


It’s an exciting time to be a member of the Fisher Investments Technology Department. We’re investing heavily in the future of our firm’s technology and are building our team to drive global growth.

We are seeking a talented Technology Business Analyst with experience supporting trade order management systems and trading-related processes. In this role, you will perform a number of duties including providing general application support, serving as an important team member on a variety of projects, and serving as an internal consultant to help optimize business processes that leverage the firm’s order management systems. The successful candidate will have strong communication skills, a background using business analysis best practices, and a strong aptitude for learning new processes and applications. This position will be located in either our Camas, WA, office (near Portland, OR) or San Mateo, CA. This will be a direct hire opportunity.

The Day-To-Day:
Partner with your business customers to understand their current and future process needs
Provide advice and alternatives to your business partners for proposed process and system changes
Elicit requirements and develop functional specifications for maintenance items, enhancements, and project-related needs
Serve as a liaison between internal business customers, the Technology Team, and our OMS vendors
Assist with business case development and estimation for projects and other initiatives
Manage configuration of the applications you support

Provide support for application-related issues
Coordinate application testing to ensure system changes are ready for production use
Develop and maintain documentation for your assigned applications
Facilitate product vision and direction setting
Work with technology vendors on your supported applications
Understand the vendor landscape for like products and serve as a catalyst for transitioning to new products when appropriate
Your Qualifications:
5+ years of experience
Hands-on experience configuring and supporting trade order management and trading back office systems.
Familiarity with order generation, trade compliance, trade execution, and trade settlement processes.
Previous experience working as a Technology Business Analyst and knowledge of best practices and methods
Excellent written and verbal communication skills including the ability to confidently present to large groups and executives
A solid understanding of Waterfall and Agile frameworks and their associated deliverables
An ability to build rapport and trust with Technology team members as well as business teams for the areas you will be supporting
Experience working with globally distributed teams
Proficiency with SQL and the ability to analyze data
Demonstrated proficiency with process diagramming and project management tools
IIBA CBAP or PMI-PBA certification desired
Completion of a 4-year degree or equivalent experience
Why Fisher Investments:

Fisher Investments is a different kind of investment firm. We don’t come from Wall Street, nor do we believe we fit in with most of the finance industry, and we’re proud of that. We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. From unmatched service to innovative perspectives on investing, it’s the people that make the Fisher purpose possible. After all, it’s our people that enable us to offer the level of service that we do. And we invest in them accordingly, offering exceptional benefits like:
100% coverage of premiums for health, vision and dental insurance
A 50% 401(k) match, up to the IRS maximum
20 days of PTO*, plus 9 paid holidays
8 week paid Primary Caregiver Parental Leave
And much, much more
We also provide a cumulative, continuous learning and development framework customized for every employee. This emphasis on personal and professional growth has yielded an award-winning work environment; we’re Great Place to Work Certified, and The Oregonian named us as a 2017 and 2018 Top Workplace.

But in the end, it’s not the perks that keep people here. They stay because they believe in our mission of service—our employees want to make a difference in an industry that can do better.

About Us:
Luma Health was founded on the idea that patients should easily be able to connect to their healthcare provider in a way that's modern and mobile-first.

For doctors, it means a full schedule, better patient outcomes, and caring for more patients. For clinics, it means a more automated practice, more revenue, and higher MIPS scores. For patients, it means getting the care they need and experiencing next-level patient care.

Needing to see a doctor is hard. Being able to see one shouldn't be.

The Role:
Are you a growth nerd who's passionate about business strategy and data-driven decision making?

Luma Health is looking for a Business Analyst to help monitor, understand and report business-critical insights from various sources both qualitative and quantitative.

As a part of the Business Operations team, you will have a unique opportunity to work closely with an impact every team at Luma Health, for us, that means Product, Sales, Marketing, and our Leadership team.

With your help, we'll fulfill our goal to ensure that everyone in the business has access to accurate information and encourage data-informed decision making across the organization.

As Luma continues to grow, and the business continues to expand, you will be responsible for setting up the system and procedural changes to ensure the ability to measure key performance indicators across all levels and functions of the business.

This role calls for incredible versatility in the ability to find solutions to the most important questions. You have to balance execution, scaling and communicating analytics in a fast-paced, often messy data environment.

While no day at Luma is the same, your tasks will be fluid and include things like:
Handle data extractions and translations from Salesforce, Marketo, and our product databases in order to build and support sustainable action plans for various business needs
Researching the market trends to help identify strategic trends
Using SQL, python or R as needed to develop consistent trend monitoring
Empowering teams at Luma Health to track business success on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis through the building and maintaining of dashboards and other tools
Consolidating our business-critical data integrity across departments
Scaling growth operations and processes by translating your analytics to business insight and action plans
We expect you to:
Thrive in a fast-paced startup environment
Have minimum of 2 years post-grad experience
Hold a Bachelor's degree or higher from an accredited university with an analytical degree
Ability to rapidly run ad hoc reports and organize output effectively in spreadsheets and presentations
Be comfortable writing SQL queries fast to pull reporting data, annotating for clarity, and optimizing for elegance with ease
Have an understanding of different databases and joining data across systems.
Communicate (written and verbal) complex findings in a structured and clear manner to a non-technical audience
Love to think on your feet and have an inquisitive nature
There is no task too big or small for you
What would set you apart?
If you know python or R
Having a sound understanding of the Healthcare industry
Familiarity with B2B SaaS business models
What We Offer:

Luma Health takes care of you and the people you care about. We're headquartered in the financial district of San Francisco (~1 block from Montgomery BART).
401k and Roth 401k benefits
Equity (stock options)
Medical, dental, vision coverage
Life insurance, Disability insurance options
Unlimited vacation time (woohoo!) as well as flexible working hours
Catered lunch 2x a week!
Open area kitchen with snacks and a variety of fresh fruits delivered weekly
Wellness/Fitness, Learning & Development, Mobile Phone benefits
Pre-tax commuter benefits (we're very close to --Montgomery BART, Muni, and the Ferry!)
Comfortable lounge areas for work and play
Happy hours and team building events!

Job Description:
We are looking for a proven Business Intelligence Analyst to join our BI Team. The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for the design, implementation & support of our data systems. You will be working closely with business users, the data infrastructure team, and data analysts to support the ongoing development of enterprise-wide BI platform. You'll be designing and implementing architecture, tools, and processes needed to provide "single source of truth" reports to support data-driven decision making.


The ideal candidate will be a skilled developer who is passionate about business intelligence, comfortable working in an agile environment and embraces the opportunity to connect with customers to define and shape our solutions.

What you'll do
Lead requirements gathering sessions, analyze requirements, design and develop analytical projects working together with users finding the best possible solution to a given business problem
Contribute to data aggregation strategy for reporting, dashboards, and self-service analytics
Build relationships with key business partners
Build highly customized reports and develop creative solutions to apply business logic
Document new and existing models, solutions, and implementations.
Ensure that collected data is within required quality standards
Train and assist users to transform data into action-oriented information and to use that information
Architect Tableau projects from end to end; Lead root cause analysis efforts for operational Tableau issues; resolve them independently or with other team members
Support business users answering complex business questions via Tableau and using ad-hoc SQL queries
About you
Ability to lead your projects - identifying user requirements to writing ETL scripts to aggregate the data to craft dashboards/reports
5-7 years of experience as a data analyst/developer
2-4 years of experience in Tableau reporting platform.
Advanced SQL skills and experience writing complex queries
Advanced data visualization skills, show the ability to tell stories and make dashboards actionable
Performance tuning and troubleshooting experience
Understanding of Tableau solution infrastructure and knowledge
Experience working directly with business users to build reports, dashboards and solving business questions with data
BS/BA, in Computer Science area, MS in Computer Science is a plus
Experience with marketplaces, logistics, or economics is a plus
About us

Founded in 2013, DoorDash is a San Francisco-based technology company passionate about transforming local businesses and dedicated to enabling new ways of working, earning, and living. Today, DoorDash connects customers with their favorite local and national restaurants in more than 1,000 cities across the United States and Canada. By building intelligent, last-mile delivery technology for local cities, DoorDash aims to connect people with the things they care about — one dash at a time.

About Pantheon

Pantheon is the only WebOps platform built from the ground up for agility. We help our customers win, where digital experience starts and matters most - their websites. We empower teams of developers, marketers, and IT professionals to focus on delivering business results while Pantheon handles uptime, performance, scalability and security. We are the fastest growing Drupal and WordPress platform in the world, powering over 200,000 sites and serving billions of pages every month. Happy customers include some of the most recognized names in high tech, higher education and NGO, such as Patch, Apigee, UC Berkeley, Arizona State University, and the United Nations.

With 35% of the web running open source, we are growing aggressively into a huge market opportunity and looking to expand our product team. That's where you come in.

The Role

As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, you will make an immediate impact as a founding member of this team. You will help transform Pantheon into a data driven company by bringing your advanced analytics experience to the organization. You will partner closely with stakeholders across all departments to understand their business challenges, develop hypotheses, and improve decision making with data driven thinking.

Pantheon's core values are Trust, Teamwork, Passion, and Customers First. At Pantheon, we value individuality, humor, and balance. We're enthusiastic participants in several open-source communities and have real relationships with many of our most active customers. If all of this sounds interesting to you, read on!

Cool Stuff You'll Do
Be a strategic voice in the development of transformative insights about our business drivers and customer base
Work with leaders across the entire organization to provide critical intelligence that drives business changing decisions
Build all-new prescriptive and predictive models using our analytics suite by asking smart questions and leveraging your analytical experience and SQL skills to provide answers
Empower business users to make better and more impactful, data-driven decisions by coaching and mentoring their collective understanding and usage of BI tools.
Interface with the data engineering and product team to enhance the business intelligence and analytics experience of team members across the company.
What You Bring To The Table
5+ years experience in business intelligence, insights, data analytics or related roles with hands-on experience working in BI and data visualization tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, Data Studio)
Proven experience building relationships and managing stakeholder data and analytics requirements
Effective ability to directly translate EDW data into answers for business stakeholders and work with data engineers to enhance the EDW data set
Advanced SQL skills applied on relational databases such as MySQL, PostGres, and BigQuery.
Capacity to work successfully in a fast-paced, start­up environment
BA/BS degree
Bonus Points For
Experience in Python
LookML development experience in Looker
What We Offer
Fantastic work environment powered by an amazing team
Unlimited vacation
Dog-friendly office (HQ)
Maternity and paternity leave
Monthly gym and book allowance
Fun at WordPress and Drupal community events
Fully loaded kitchen and daily catered lunches (HQ, NY, MN)
Discounts on custom bicycles (the founders of Pantheon also founded Mission Bicycle)
Fast Facts
Pantheon recently closed its Series D funding ($40m) <link>
Pantheon is one of America's Best Workplaces of 2018 <link>
Pantheon earns Top 10 Ranking in "Best Software Awards" by G2 Crowd <link>
Pantheon actively sponsors programs like the Grace Hopper Celebration (GHC 19) <link>

Institute on Aging (IOA) is dedicated to preserving the dignity, independence and well-being of aging adults and people with disabilities. Our broad spectrum of services addresses not just the traditional health care needs of our clients, but the needs of the whole person as well – from mental health services to housing support, in-home care, crisis intervention, social isolation programs, caregiver support and intensive case management.

This break-through model of care, and our 40+ years of hands-on innovation, have dramatically enhanced the quality of life for our clients, improved their health outcomes and reduced costs for our payer partners. Our track record of success is why Institute on Aging is recognized as a national leader in shaping healthcare policy.

At UCSF Health, our mission of innovative patient care, advanced technology and pioneering research is redefining what’s possible for the patients we serve – a promise we share with the professionals who make up our team.

Ranked by U.S. News & World Report as seventh in the country – UCSF Health is committed to providing the most rewarding work experience while delivering the best care available anywhere. In an environment that allows for continuous learning and opportunities for professional growth, UCSF Health offers the ideal atmosphere in which to best use your skills and talents.
Department Description
UCSF Health brings clinical and research service capabilities into a unified structure and single operating unit, achieving strategic, operational and financial alignment between the School of Medicine, Medical Group, and the Medical Center, as well as provider affiliates.

Its structure streamlines decision making, strengthens the ability to act with one voice, and ensures accountability at every point to execute collectively agreed upon commitment to excellence and efficiency.

UCSF Health’s 2020 vision is to provide innovative, high-quality, cost-competitive clinical services, and deliver an unparalleled patient experience across the entire care continuum.
Job Summary
The Value Improvement program was initiated to identify and deliver process improvements and efficiency savings. The Business Intelligence Analyst brings deep analytic skills to bear on largely unexplored or misunderstood financial and operational data to develop insights on where and how to focus organizational or departmental improvement efforts.

The analyst uses advanced knowledge of financial and clinical systems and industry practices to turn generalized opportunities into specific tactics to support operational efficiencies and strategic planning, and advises operational leaders and their teams on how to connect cost (and related savings) to the work performed. Analyst will work to develop strong linkages between input costs, improvement work and return on investment (ROI). Analyst will be a critical part of a team that may consist of physicians and other healthcare providers, and department leaders or process owners within IT, finance, and operations.

Responsibilities will include gathering data and producing highly complex and unique analyses / investigations of performance, utilization, clinical programs, market trends, and financial analyses in support of due diligence, billing and collection of revenue, and tracking of performance. Analyzes, evaluates and troubleshoots highly complex schedules and data for data errors and problems, designing, testing and applying advanced functional solutions.

The analyst is responsible for reporting and accountability of performance initiatives. Ensures details comply with finance policies and procedures. Gathers data and information from the managerial financial reporting system, the EPSi budget advisor system, and other applications to integrate overall financial performance at a cost center, division and other hierarchical levels. Provides for the measurement and benchmarking of business operations in relation to best business practices for the healthcare industry and internal business objectives, developing and presenting quantitative business cases to operational leaders and their teams.

Develops and maintains key relationships with organizational functional areas to meet the organization’s needs for effective system-wide financial ad hoc analyses. Applies extensive knowledge of industry practices in healthcare decision support and advanced professional concepts to substantial projects, typically at high degrees of complexity.

The successful candidate will work closely with physicians, leadership, medical center and faculty practice finance teams, decision support professionals, department managers, and outside consultants. The candidate must be able to thrive and succeed in a changing environment, and not be hindered by ambiguity or competing priorities.

An ability to take sparse information and successfully break down projects, initiatives and strategic priorities is expected. Maturity, high judgment, negotiation.
Required Qualifications
Five to seven years of healthcare decision support or financial analysis experience
Bachelor’s degree in Finance or related field with or equivalent combination of education and experience
Ability to independently gather relevant data from stakeholder groups, perform statistical analyses, and organize into models that support budgeting and forecasting
In-depth understanding of decision support systems, with knowledge of business statistics, quantitative methods, relational databases, business development scorecards, data modeling, and performance and profitability analysis
In-depth knowledge of issues and aspects of clinical finance, planning, financial data management, budget development and business development; proficiency in utilizing the tools to produce comprehensive, studies and actionable intelligence
In-depth ability to work with senior staff and managers across departments, serving as a technical leader and information resource in decision support, and providing recommendations and advice on decision support processes, business and financial issues
Advanced organizational and project management skills, and ability to lead a team, prioritize tasks, and see projects through from inception to completion on schedule
Advanced interpersonal skills, with the ability to lead projects and teams and collaborate productively on highly-complex projects with key personnel at all professional and technical levels
Advanced written and verbal communications skills, with the ability to interpret and convey highly sophisticated technical and financial information in a clear, concise manner, and to make cogent presentations of analyses, reports, and investigation results
Advanced problem-solving skills analytical ability, and in-depth knowledge of documentation and reporting, with the ability to run highly complex queries and studies, to collect and analyze financial and performance data, and to produce relevant, meaningful reports, analyses, and forecasts
Experience performing complex data analysis and transformation utilizing various iterations of SQL with tools such as Excel, MS-Access, MS SQL, or SAS
Understanding of variation and able to apply statistical tools to large data sets to uncover anomalies
Skills in project management and process re-design / re-engineering
Demonstrated ability to achieve results I a virtual and matrixed team environment
Self-motivated, results-oriented, demonstrating strong initiative
Ability to work under time constraints, meeting deadlines and schedule
Flexible and have a positive attitude and a sense of humor is highly desirable
The flexibility to orient and work at all UCSF Medical Center locations

Master’s degree in statistics, public health, or related field
Experience working with patient financial data in an acute hospital setting. Exposure to analysis at both the summary and detail level
Experience using EPSi or another hospital decision support software application is desirable, as is having worked in an EPIC health records environment
Experience with health care facility cost accounting and/or billing systems with a high-level understanding of where they do and do not integrate well with medical records
Experience at an academic medical center
Experience with commonly-used healthcare data sources (e.g., UHC’s CDB/RM or ODB/Action OI databases, Sg2, etc.)

About Us:


Mercari is the selling app. We make it super easy to sell (or buy) almost anything. We all have things we don't use, never used or simply outgrew. But that stuff still has value. Mercari gives you the power to simply sell it, ship it, and earn some cash for it. Fashion to toys. Sporting goods to electronics. All the brands you know and love. Our mission is simple: to make selling easier than buying. And with 45M+ downloads in the U.S. and 150k new listings every day, we're just getting started.

Mercari has over 100 million installs and millions of active users creating billions of data events that we need to turn into actionable insights. Our insights will help drive product improvement, efficient customer acquisition, user retention, a more efficient marketplace, a safe community of buyers and sellers, and overall monitoring of business performance. From data collection, normalization across platforms, analysis, and institutionalizing reporting measurements and dimensions, and data visualization, this is an opportunity to go deep on the full data stack to accelerate Mercari's growth.

What You'll Be Doing:
Work with the business intelligence and engineering groups to understand existing internal tools and data warehouses and to identify data quality and reliability improvements
Collaborate with teams across Product, Engineering, Marketing, Trust & Safety to understand how the business operates and recommend strategies to drive continuous improvement using data driven insights
Design, develop, test and launch new dashboards and reporting solutions into production
Maintain and support reports and dashboards running in production
Develop quantitative models utilizing analytical tools, statistical rigor and data mining capabilities to drive efficiency
Help product managers & operational teams establish benchmarks, inputs and critical metrics for new initiatives
Develop insights to guide the segmentation of users on both sides of the marketplace
Conduct deep dives & analytical investigations into inconsistent trends in data
Build key data sets to empower operational and exploratory analysis
Provide guidance and develop data standards and reporting best practices
What You'll Need:


3+ years' experience in a business intelligence role
Bachelor's Degree in Business, Business Intelligence or related field required
Ability to understand and find appropriate applications for data and analysis results
Experience analyzing data from 3rd party providers: Google Analytics, Site Catalyst, Coremetrics, Adwords, AppBoy/Braze, etc.
Experience with visualization and dashboard applications like Looker, Chartio, Tableau
Extensive SQL experience for data extraction, manipulation and analyses; including complex joins, creation of views, stored procedures, and database scripting
Why Mercari?


Mercari nurtures an all for one environment where teamwork and innovative thinking is the priority.

Integrate data from analytics tools and APIs (Mixpanel, Google Analytics)
Collaborate closely with product and software teams to prioritize feature development

Experience with statistical modeling and analyzing large data sets
Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills
Experience identifying and communicating analytical outcomes, verbally and in writing, to both business and technical teams
